title: Chef John's Cheesecake Flan Recipe
description: For Chef John's cheesecake flan recipe, a creamy, cheesy custard bakes inside caramel-lined ramekins to create a hybrid between cheesecake and flan.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Desserts Cakes Cheesecake Recipes Chef John's Cheesecake Flan 5.0 (10) 10 Reviews 5 Photos A cheesecake-like custard bakes over a layer of caramel in my attempt at making a flan that tastes like cheesecake. Much to my (pleasant) surprise, I ended up with a flan-flavored cheesecake instead, thanks to the power of caramelized sugar. Be careful; that thin layer of caramel can be overpowering. Whether or not you make a successful graham cracker crust topping, I hope you try this gorgeous recipe soon. By John Mitzewich John Mitzewich John Mitzewich — aka Chef John — has produced more than 1,500 cooking videos for Allrecipes. He's the actor, director, and screenwriter whose hands and voice confidently walk you through techniques. Allrecipes' editorial guidelines Updated on April 2, 2025 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 5 5 5 5 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 55 mins Additional Time: 2 hrs 20 mins Total Time: 3 hrs 25 mins Servings: 4 Yield: 4 (5 1/2-ounce) flans Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings Caramel: 1 teaspoon vegetable oil ½ cup white sugar 2 tablespoons white sugar Custard: ½ cup cream cheese, at room temperature 3 large eggs, beaten 2 tablespoons grated Parmesan cheese ¾ teaspoon vanilla extract 1 pinch salt 1 cup milk 2 tablespoons milk ½ cup white sugar Topping: ½ cup graham cracker crumbs (Optional) 2 tablespoons butter, melted (Optional) Directions Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (160 degrees C). Coat insides of four 5 1/2-ounce ramekins with oil. Melt 1/2 cup plus 2 tablespoons sugar in a skillet over medium heat without stirring; swirl the skillet occasionally until sugar caramelizes to an amber color. Quickly pour caramel into each prepared ramekin to cover the bottoms. Place ramekins in a large baking dish. Whisk cream cheese, eggs, Parmesan cheese, vanilla extract, and salt together in a bowl until smooth. Heat milk in a small saucepan until almost simmering; stir in 1/2 cup sugar until dissolved. Stir into cream cheese mixture until custard combined. Spoon custard mixture into the prepared ramekins. Carefully add enough hot water to the roasting pan to come halfway up the sides of the ramekins. Bake in the preheated oven until custard is just barely set, 45 to 60 minutes. Custard should jiggle as one mass, when shaken. Remove ramekins from the baking dish; cool to room temperature, about 20 minutes. Combine graham cracker crumbs and melted butter in a bowl; sprinkle over each flan. Refrigerate until fully chilled, at least 2 hours. Run a knife along edges of chilled flans; invert onto plates. Drizzle any remaining caramel on top. Chef's Notes: I used four (5 1/2-ounce) ramekins, and had a little remaining custard, so you can probably get five out of this recipe if you use slightly smaller ramekins, or fill them with less batter. Ramekins can also be coated with melted butter. Editor's Note: Nutrition data for this recipe includes the full amount of custard. The actual amount consumed will vary. I Made It Print 22 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Chef John's Cheesecake Flan 01 of 05 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 05 Photo by  Food Lover 08/29/2021 I followed the recipe to the bottom of the letter. Except, I used pyrex for baking it. No the small ramikens. I have a family of 5 and I need extra, always. I adjusted the ingredients to 8 portions I stead of 4 or six. I must confess, it came out delicious. I highly recommend this recipe and don't be afraid to experiment. 03 of 05 Photo by  ruth bouret 03/29/2020 04 of 05 Photo by  John Mitzewich 02/14/2019 1 You’ll Also Love Basque Cheesecake 47 Ratings Japanese Cotton Cheesecake 2 Ratings Cookie Butter Cheesecake 7 Ratings How to Make Pumpkin Cheesecake 48 Ratings S'mores Pieces Cheesecake 5 Ratings Cheesecake Pops Recipe 49 Ratings Chocolate Cheesecake 116 Ratings Lemon Meringue Cheesecake 223 Ratings Butter Pecan Cheesecake 43 Ratings Mini Strawberry Cheesecakes Quick and Easy Cheesecake Pie 6 Ratings Strawberry Cheesecake 319 Ratings PHILLY Chocolate Turtles Cheesecake 15 Ratings New York-Style Cheesecake 294 Ratings Grasshopper Cheesecake Bars 4 Ratings Trick or Treat Cheesecake 2 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: John Mitzewich

Refrigerate until fully chilled, at least 2 hours.;Run a knife along edges of chilled flans; invert onto plates. Drizzle any remaining caramel on top.
